solution.text:
y = _{{18*k}}_
\(\Rightarrow\) Since X and Y are inversely proportional XY = K
\(\Rightarrow\) Therefore, K =\( ( 3 \times _{j}_) \times ( 6 \times _{k}_ ) = 18 \times _{j}_ \times _{k}_\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Hence, when x = _{j}_
\(\Rightarrow\) y =\( \frac {18 \times _{j}_ \times _{k}_}{_{j}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) y= _{{18*k}}_

content.text: x= _{{3*j}}_ when y = _{{6*k}}_. Find y when x = _{j}_.
